intro: Espostoa lanata subsp. lanianuligera, commonly known as the woolly espostoa, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of pink or white. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
